definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to drag sb along against his will/to draw a forced analogy
to take long strides/to hurry (while walking)

sentences.english: The Mu comes out from Ye in the bedroom, (…) , ruthlessly hold ascend.
sentences.chinese: 姆從臥室裏拽出來，狠狠地捧上一頓。

sentences.english: The only game I like to paly is tugging .
sentences.chinese: 唯一的比賽我想帕利是拽。

sentences.english: Drag or slide cylinders, even for short distances.
sentences.chinese: 拉拽或滑動鋼瓶，即使是很短的距離。

sentences.english: He quickly opens the door and fumbles an arm and pulls it hard.
sentences.chinese: 他趕緊打開車門，摸到一隻手臂，使勁拽。

sentences.english: The sand dropped off steeply, and a riptide was sucking the woman un-der.
sentences.chinese: 沙牀邊緣非常陡峭，並且激流的吸力將婦人往下拽。

sentences.english: The demand for circumcision seems to have caught everybody off guard.
sentences.chinese: 割包皮的要求似乎將每個人都拽回了警戒線內。

sentences.english: Emboldened, I yanked the strap of her backpack and then pushed her.
sentences.chinese: 我壯了壯膽，猛拽她揹包的帶子，然後往前一推。

sentences.english: If one of them tries to crawl up the side, the rest will pull it back down." Johanna Tuckman
sentences.chinese: 就算有一個想往上爬，其它的也會把它拽下來。

sentences.english: With the water's tow, they'd never get to him in time.
sentences.chinese: 由於水的拉拽，他們根本不可能及時游到小男孩身邊。

sentences.english: JiangYuHe plucked at her hand, ask her to stay commune.
sentences.chinese: 姜宇赫拽住她的手，請求她留下來談心。

sentences.english: One of the children was pawing at my sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 有個孩子一個勁地拽我的袖子。

sentences.english: Is the laptop tying him down, or about to set him free?

sentences.english: He tugged again. Murdoch remained as he was.
sentences.chinese: 他又一拽，默多克仍然沒動。

sentences.english: Think about it, it's pulling from the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 你們想想看，向下拉拽天花板的張力。

sentences.english: Jingjing, meanwhile, tried to comfort William. His internal injuries were dragging him relentlessly toward death.
sentences.chinese: 京京正設法安慰威廉，內傷正無情地把他拽向死亡。

definition: to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to attempt all tasks at once/to manage every detail regardless of its importance
to drag/to pull/to raise a child (through difficulties)/to help/to support/to drag in/to chat
to lift/to carry in one's hand/Taiwan pr. [ling1]
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
